chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI Cause Injury (2+) and PAC Cause Injury (2+). The defendant was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+) and the other charge, PAC Cause Injury (2+) was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael J Meganck was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
84 days credit if revoked.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel Meeting on 2/18/2015 or 30 days jail with Huber.

miscConds.notes:
Court Costs, DNA and Blood draw Costs all paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Count 6 was dismissed outright.
REFUND CASH BAIL BACK TO THE POSTERS.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael J Meganck in court, in custody, with attorney Joan B Broughton.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court advises counsel he is familiar with Atty. Boisits. Counsels have no objection. State advises a family member is familiar with the defendant's father. Defense/Defendant have no objection to this.  Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 3 years (Initial Confinement: 18 months - 84 days credit, Extended Supervision: 18 months) Stayed for 2 years Probation 
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 2 years Drivers License Revocation. 
- 2 years Ignition Interlock on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel meeting on February 18, 2015, or 30 days jail with huber
- Alcohol Assessment
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to Muskego Police Department to be paid as a condition of Probation. 
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation:  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. 
- 6 months jail Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing FORTHWITH.   Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence forthwith.

REFUND BAIL TO PERSON WHO POSTED IT.

filed by Atty Broughton with a family statement.
From P&P Agent requesting a one week extension of the due date for the PSI.  The Court has reviewed the request and granted an extension of the PSI due date until November 18, 2014 at 4:00 pm.
Character letter filed by D.W.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: October 15, 2014 Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Envelope: Return to Sender - Not Deliverable as Addressed - Unable to Forward.
Character letter filed by M.H.

Sentencing hearing on November 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michael J Meganck in court, in custody, with attorney Joan B Broughton.   Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises the State is asking for a PSI however, Defense would like to proceed to sentencing today. Court advises counsel he is familiar with one of the injured parties in the case. Defense has had a short discussion with her client and they are prepared to proceed. State is not prepared to proceed to sentencing today and states why on the record. Court will benefit from a PSI and will order it today.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2, 3, 4, 5, 7 and 8 dismissed and read-in. Ct. 6 dismissed by operation of law. Court orders a PSI to be compiled and filed within 30 days. Court orders bail revoked. Court will set the matter for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Character letter filed by A.N.
Character letter filed by N.H.

Defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.   Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Defendant to have no contact with Gerald B.. Defendant may have contact with Lindsey B.  if released but not to discuss this matter in any way, shape or form.   Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring if bail posted immediately upon release from jail.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.

Defendant Michael J Meganck in court, in custody, with attorney Joan B Broughton.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense address bail and requests the increase of $5000.00 cash bail previously ordered be amended to $3000.00 cash bail. Defense requests to modify the no contact order to Lindsey B. be lifted or to a no violent contact order. State opposes modification of bail. Court will not lower bail. Court will modify conditions of bail to reflect Defendant may have contact with Lindsey B. if released  but not to discuss this matter in any way, shape or form. Defense would like to enter a plea. Court will give another date for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
